SEARCH
Package mz

Interface SortFind<T extends Comparable>

Type Parameters:
T - setting of a type based on which the elements can be sorted. It is not mandatory to specify, additional pre-written subclasses specify the type.
All Superinterfaces:
Sort<T>
All Known Subinterfaces:
SelectionInterface<T>
All Known Implementing Classes:
Bubble, Cocktail, Comb, DoubleSelection, Gnome, IntroBubble, IntroCocktail, IntroComb, IntroDoubleSelection, IntroDPQBubble, IntroDPQCocktail, IntroDPQComb, IntroDPQDoubleSelection, IntroDPQGnome, IntroDPQOddEven, IntroDPQSelection, IntroGnome, IntroOddEven, IntroSelection, OddEven, Selection
public interface SortFind<T extends Comparable> extends Sort<T>
SortFind offered a pre-implemented methodology that can be added and modified outside the hierarchical system.
Since:
1.0

    Sort.SortType

  • Method Details

    • findMax

      default T findMax(T[] array)
      findMax is a generic method for finding the maximum element in an array of type T. The generic type T should implement the Comparable interface, which allows the use of the compareTo method for comparisons.
      • The method is declared with a generic type T, and it has a default implementation. This means that classes implementing this interface don't need to provide their own implementation of this method.
      • The SuppressWarnings("unchecked") annotation is used to suppress compiler warnings related to unchecked generic array creation. This is because arrays of generic types in Java are not type-safe, and the compiler generates warnings to indicate this.
      • The method takes an array of type T as a parameter.
      • The first element of the array is assigned to the max variable as the initial maximum value.
      • The method then iterates over the remaining elements of the array (starting from index 1) and compares each element to the current maximum using the compareTo method. If an element is greater than the current maximum, it becomes the new maximum.
      • Finally, the method returns the maximum element found in the array.
      Parameters:
      array - in which to find the maximum.
      Returns:
      the maximum element found in the array.

    • findMaxIndex

      default int findMaxIndex(T[] array)
      findMaxIndex is a generic method for finding the maximum element in an array of type T. The generic type T should implement the Comparable interface, which allows the use of the compareTo method for comparisons.
      • The method is declared with a generic type T, and it has a default implementation. This means that classes implementing this interface don't need to provide their own implementation of this method.
      • The SuppressWarnings("unchecked") annotation is used to suppress compiler warnings related to unchecked generic array creation. This is because arrays of generic types in Java are not type-safe, and the compiler generates warnings to indicate this.
      • The method takes an array of type T as a parameter.
      • The first element of the array is assigned to the max variable as the initial maximum value.
      • The maxIndex variable is initialized with 0, representing the index of the current maximum element.
      • The method then iterates over the remaining elements of the array (starting from index 1) and compares each element to the current maximum using the compareTo method. If an element is greater than the current maximum, it becomes the new maximum, and its index becomes the new maxIndex.
      • Finally, the method returns the index of the maximum element found in the array.
      Parameters:
      array - in which to find the maximum.
      Returns:
      index of the maximum element found in the array.

    • findMaximumIndex

      default int findMaximumIndex(T[] array, int a, int b)
      findMaximumIndex that finds the b of the maximum element in a portion of an array of Comparable objects.
      • The method takes in an array of Comparable objects, array, an integer a representing the current b, and an integer b representing the current b of the maximum element.
      • The method compares the element at b a with the element at b b using the compareTo method.
      • If the element at b a is greater than the element at b b, the if condition evaluates to true, and the value of b is updated to a.
      • The updated value of b is then returned.
      findMaximumIndex method compares the element at b a with the current maximum element represented by b in the given array of Comparable objects. It updates and returns the b of the maximum element if the element at b a is greater.
      Parameters:
      array - to be arranged.
      a - an integer representing the current b.
      b - representing the current b of the maximum element.
      Returns:
      the b of the maximum element.

    • findMinimumIndex

      default int findMinimumIndex(T[] array, int a, int b)
      findMinimumIndex that finds the b of the minimum element in a portion of an array of Comparable objects.
      • The method takes in an array of Comparable objects, array, an integer a representing the current b, and an integer b representing the current b of the minimum element.
      • The method compares the element at b a with the element at b b using the compareTo method.
      • If the element at b a is smaller than the element at b b, the if condition evaluates to true, and the value of b is updated to a.
      • The updated value of b is then returned.
      findMinimumIndex method compares the element at b a with the current minimum element represented by b in the given array of Comparable objects. It updates and returns the b of the minimum element if the element at b a is smaller.
      Parameters:
      array - to be arranged.
      a - an integer representing the current b.
      b - representing the current b of the minimum element.
      Returns:
      the b of the minimum element.
